alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 06 at 2:24PM AKST until January 08 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Strong winds with blowing snow, low visibility and cold wind chills occuring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Visibility will be one half mile or less at times. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. Wind chills to 55 below. * WHERE...In Passes. * WHEN...Until 6 PM Saturday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...North winds gusting to 50 mph in passes are causing blowing and drifting snow with low visibility. Cold wind chills as low as 55 below zero will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. The strongest winds and worst visibility are expected now through Friday. The coldest winds chills are expected Friday through Saturday. Larger snow drifts will form. Avalanches will be possible near steep terrain. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for blowing snow means periods of blowing snow will cause travel difficulties. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
